The Merc 319 is built to maximize ventilation and airflow. There’s a large fin-stack heatsink, which, is not significantly blocked by the cooler shrowd or backplate. If you have your heart set on the RX 7800 XT (and who can blame you if you do?), it makes sense to check out the most affordable version of the card. The GIGABYTE Radeon RX 7800 XT Gaming OC manages to be one of the best GPUs under $500, while still packing a tonne of power. It has an out-of-the-box clock speed that rates among the fastest of any of the Navi 320-based GPUs, clocking in at a base speed of 2124MHz. On top of that, there is the sophisticated Windforce cooling system. This consists of three 90mm blade fans, which spin in alternate directions, as well as 7 copper heat pipes, 3D active fans and screen cooling. Taken together this ensures your card can run a full power without overheating. PowerColor Hellhound boosts the RX 7800 XT’s factory overclock, up from 2124MHz on the reference card, to 2214MHz. The clock speed of a graphic card, tells you how many processing cycles it can complete in a second, the higher the speed, the more calculations the card can complete in the same amount of time, and thus the more graphic power it can produce. The one downside of this is that it can increase your card’s temperature. Fortunately PowerColor Hellhound has you covered there as well. There’s a large triple-slot cooling solution coupled with three double ball-bearing, LED backlit fans. These are pretty simple to remove too, making for easier maintenance. On top of that, the card comes with DrMOS software compatibility, which allows you to digitally monitor your card’s performance and temperature. Pair it with the best motherboard for gaming, and the best CPU for the RX 7800 XT and you’ll have yourself a formidable gaming rig. Overall, the RX 7800 XT is an impressive top-end graphics card.
